contextId.information: Even though the author uses the plural pronoun "we," he is most likely referring only to himself. AT: "I have much to say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
Even though the author uses the plural pronoun "we," he is most likely referring only to himself. AT: "I am convinced" or "I am certain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
Even though the author uses the plural pronoun "we," he is most likely referring only to himself. AT: "I am saying" or "I am writing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
Even though the author uses the plural pronoun "we," he is most likely referring only to himself. AT: "which I cannot" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
